CD11b rs1143679 polymorphism appears to be associated with risk for SLE in the Han Chinese population, and may play an important role in the development of lupus nephritis.
Integrin alphaM is a specific marker of activated tissue eosinophils in Eosinophilic esophagitis, and promotes eosinophil survival through interactions with periostin.
results identify PF4 as a ligand for the integrin Mac-1 and suggest that many immune-modulating effects previously ascribed to PF4 are mediated through its interaction with Mac-1

Cis interaction between sialylated FcgammaRIIA and the alphaI-domain of Mac-1 alters the threshold for IgG-mediated neutrophil recruitment. A disruption of this interaction may increase neutrophil influx in autoimmune diseases.
data do not support a particular role for TAM receptors or for activated CD11b in the association of platelet-derived EVs with monocytes and granulocytes in the circulation.
Mast cells may convey immunoregulatory signals through C3, C3b, and iC3b to CD11b(+) cells, especially in BCC.

Study evaluated the association of urinary levels of CD11b and CD16b released from glomerular leukocyte subsets with histological disease activity in patients with various glomerular diseases, particularly lupus nephritis (LN). Results suggest that urinary CD11b may be a useful biomarker to estimate histopathological activity, particularly glomerular leukocyte accumulation, in LN.

HES treatment impaired the chemotaxis only towards fMLP, event mainly ascribed to the inhibition of CD-11b (Mac-1 integrin) activity. Therefore, the observed effect mediated by HES should be taken into account during volume replacement therapies.
Study determine that LFA-1 and Mac-1 distinctly regulate the neutrophil extravasation cascade.

SNP rs4597342 in 3'UTR of ITGAM influencing miR-21 binding may be considered a risk factor for psoriasis development. Upregulated miR-21 in psoriasis is likely to inhibit CD11b production in the case of the rs4597342 T allele which may lead to Mac-1 dysfunction, resulting in an aberrant function of innate immune cells and leading to the production of cytokines involved in psoriasis pathogenesis

results suggested that ITGAX and ITGAM gene polymorphisms were associated with IgA nephropathy (IgAN) in a Chinese Han population, and the rs11150619-T allele showed a potential protective role for IgAN.
Utilization of Biomarkers in Lupus Nephritis.

Study data in patients from Mexico show that all four ITGAM SNPs (rs34572943, rs1143679, rs9888739, and rs1143683) are significantly associated with susceptibility to systemic lupus erythematosus using both genotypic and allelic association tests. None of the four SNPs are significant in rheumatoid arthritis (RA) after multiple testing. ITGAM rs1143679 (A) minor allele showed an association with protection against RA.

Study reports the structures of a staphylococcal pore-forming cytotoxin, leukocidin GH (LukGH), in complex with its receptor (the alpha-I domain of complement receptor 3, CD11b-I), both for the human and murine homologs. Study observes 2 binding interfaces, on the LukG and the LukH protomers, and show that human CD11b-I induces LukGH oligomerization in solution.

reactome.name: Cell surface interactions at the vascular wall

summary: This gene encodes the integrin alpha M chain. Integrins are heterodimeric integral membrane proteins composed of an alpha chain and a beta chain. This I-domain containing alpha integrin combines with the beta 2 chain (ITGB2) to form a leukocyte-specific integrin referred to as macrophage receptor 1 ('Mac-1'), or inactivated-C3b (iC3b) receptor 3 ('CR3'). The alpha M beta 2 integrin is important in the adherence of neutrophils and monocytes to stimulated endothelium, and also in the phagocytosis of complement coated particles. Multiple transcript variants encoding different isoforms have been found for this gene. [provided by RefSeq, Mar 2009].
